summary: This is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List showing Jeffrey Epstein's private flight travel records from April to June 2019. The document tracks his arrivals and departures on his private jet (N212JE) between various airports, including Teterboro, Palm Beach, and an international location (LFPB).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the travel record, listed as a passenger on multiple flights on his private jet (N212JE) between April and June 2019.

locations: LFPB (likely an international airport, possibly Le Bourget in Paris)
TIST (likely an airport code, possibly Cyril E. King Airport in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was actively traveling on his private jet (tail number N212JE) between April and June 2019, just months before his arrest in July 2019.
The travel patterns show frequent flights between Teterboro (KTEB), Palm Beach (KPBI), TIST (likely St. Thomas), and LFPB (likely Paris).
The document is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) TECS Person Encounter List, indicating government monitoring of his international and domestic travel.
All entries list Epstein as a passenger (PIS PASSENGER), with some entries marked with 'INS' (Immigration and Naturalization Service) and 'CUSTOMS'.
The document was generated on June 19, 2019, and is marked 'For Official Use Only / Law Enforcement Sensitive'.
